definition[0]: someone who is bad-tempered becomes easily annoyed and talks in an angry way to people
definition[1]: becoming easily annoyed and talking in an angry unfriendly way to people
example[0]: Her husband was a disagreeable, bad-tempered man.
example[1]: I was wondering why she had been so bad-tempered recently.
definition[2]: often becoming annoyed or unhappy, especially when there seems to be no good reason
example[3]: Myra can be a bit moody sometimes.
definition[3]: easily annoyed about small things, especially because you are tired, upset, or worried
example[4]: I hadn’t had much sleep and was feeling tired and irritable.
example[5]: Since Steve quit smoking, he’s been really irritable.
example[6]: You’re turning into an irritable old man.
definition[4]: easily annoyed and often complaining about things – used especially when talking about people you know well. These words sound much gentler and less critical than bad-tempered
example[7]: There’s no need to be so grumpy!
example[8]: He woke up in a grouchy mood.
definition[5]: to be feeling annoyed or unhappy, so that you do not speak in a normal friendly way to people – used especially when this only lasts for a fairly short period of time and is not part of someone’s usual character
example[9]: Leave him alone – he’s in a bad mood today.
example[10]: By the time I got home at 9 o'clock, I was in a really bad mood.
definition[6]: to be likely to become angry very suddenly, especially in an unreasonable way
example[11]: Be careful what you say to the Colonel - he’s got a very short fuse.
definition[7]: bad-tempered and complaining or quarrelling a lot – used especially about old people
example[12]: The hotel owner was a cantankerous old man.
example[13]: In later years, she became quite cantankerous.
